title: [Health] Analyzing the calories burned by more 6,600 people, researchers suggest that our metabolisms don’t really start to decline until after age 60. The slowdown is gradual, only 0.7% a year. But a person in their 90s needs 26% fewer calories each day than someone in midlife
[Health] Sex‐ and strain‐specific effects of mitochondrial uncoupling on age‐related metabolic diseases in high‐fat diet‐fed mice (Jan 2022)
